description.narrative: The Pacific Biomedical Equipment Maintenance initiative helps small Pacific countries who have difficulty in recruiting and retraining engineers to maintain and repair essential hospital equipment. The funding supports the recruitment of qualified biomedical engineers (BMEs) through Australian Volunteers International (AVI) for 18 months. One BME to be placed in each of Polynesia, Melanesia and Micronesia, each with a budget for regular travel to cover a number of other partner countries within that group. The BMEs' functions include: planned maintenance of hospital equipment; undertake repairs of viable equipment; train users in correct use of equipment, maintenance, fault diagnosis and minor repairs as appropriate; establish / maintain of hospital equipment inventory; undertake planning and budgeting for maintenance, repair and replacement with hospital boards; and contribute to the development of a "Pacific standard" for biomedical equipment and hospital plant.
